title: Donquixote Family's Connection to World Government Formation
theory: The revelation that the Donquixote family enslaved the Tontatta dwarves 900 years ago suggests that the Donquixote family was one of the 20 kingdoms that formed the World Government during the Void Century. This explains Doflamingo's connection to the Celestial Dragons and hints that the original King Donquixote was among those who committed atrocities during the Void Century to establish the current world order.
author: One Piece Fan Community

title: Parallels Between Dressrosa and Alabasta Arcs
theory: Both Dressrosa and Alabasta have histories dating back to the Void Century (900 years ago). The Nefertari family refused to become Celestial Dragons while the Donquixote family became one of the 20 ruling families. Both kingdoms have underground elements (the Tontatta Kingdom and the Poneglyph chamber), and both involve rebellions against corrupt leadership. This parallel suggests Oda is exploring different outcomes when ancient kingdoms interact with the World Government's formation.
author: One Piece Theory Community

title: Tontatta Tribe's Role in the Ancient Kingdom
theory: The Tontatta dwarves' 900-year conflict with the Donquixote family suggests they may have been allied with or part of the Ancient Kingdom that opposed the 20 kingdoms during the Void Century. Their enslavement by the Donquixote family could represent the World Government's systematic oppression of those who supported the Ancient Kingdom. Their incredible strength despite small size and their possession of ancient knowledge might connect them to the lost civilization.
author: Library of Ohara / Fan Theorists

title: Usopp's Destiny as a True Hero
theory: Usopp being recognized as 'Usoland' by the dwarves isn't just a case of mistaken identity - it's foreshadowing his eventual growth into a true brave warrior of the sea. The dwarves' unwavering faith in him will be the catalyst that forces Usopp to overcome his cowardice and become the hero he claims to be. This episode marks the beginning of Usopp's most significant character development arc.
author: Reddit r/OnePiece Community
